title: How to Make Gluten Free Buttermilk Biscuits

steps.headline: Stir free the milk substitute and vinegar if you are using the dairy free buttermilk.
Stir together all of the dry ingredients.
steps.description: They are the almond flour, cornstarch, baking powder, xanthan gum, salt, and sugar. Be sure they are thoroughly mixed together.

steps.headline: Cut in the butter with a fork or a pastry cutter.
steps.description: Do this until everything is very well blended.

steps.headline: Stir in the eggs and the buttermilk mixture.
steps.description: If your dough is a bit wet, add 1 or 2 tablespoons (14.8 or 29.6 ml) of the almond flour. You want your dough to be sticky, but not wet.

steps.headline: Grease your pan lightly or line with baking paper.
Roll the dough into golf sized balls and place them in the pan.
steps.description: Be sure that they are close together but not quite touching each other. The recipe should make 10-12 biscuits.

steps.headline: Press each biscuit down lightly to flatten it, just a little bit.
Bake for 17 - 20 minutes or until they are lightly browned.

text: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C)  Stir free the milk substitute and vinegar if you are using the dairy free buttermilk. Allow it to stand. Stir together all of the dry ingredients. They are the almond flour, cornstarch, baking powder, xanthan gum, salt, and sugar. Be sure they are thoroughly mixed together. Cut in the butter with a fork or a pastry cutter. Do this until everything is very well blended. Stir in the eggs and the buttermilk mixture. If your dough is a bit wet, add 1 or 2 tablespoons (14.8 or 29.6 ml) of the almond flour. You want your dough to be sticky, but not wet. Grease your pan lightly or line with baking paper.  Roll the dough into golf sized balls and place them in the pan. Be sure that they are close together but not quite touching each other. The recipe should make 10-12 biscuits. Press each biscuit down lightly to flatten it, just a little bit.  Bake for 17 - 20 minutes or until they are lightly browned.
